content:
Diagnosis:
Cervical adenocarcinoma Stage IIA1

Previous Treatment:
Radical chemoradiotherapy completed January 2024

Current Situation:
Routine follow-up at 3 months post-treatment

Current symptoms:
No active symptoms
Good energy levels
Mild vaginal dryness managed with topical moisturizer

Examination:
No cervical or vaginal abnormality
No lymphadenopathy
Soft non-tender abdomen

Plan:
Continue current surveillance protocol
Repeat MRI pelvis in 3 months
Next clinic review in 4 months with imaging
To continue with local GP for routine cervical screening as per protocol

Patient understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop

cancer_timeline.value: 3 month follow-up shows no evidence of disease on examination

patient_facts.value: Mild vaginal dryness managed with topical moisturizer
No cervical or vaginal abnormality, no lymphadenopathy, soft non-tender abdomen

status_updates.value: Stage IIA1 cervical adenocarcinoma treated with radical chemoradiotherapy. Clinically well at 3 month follow-up with no concerning features
Clinic review in 4 months with imaging
